comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.123exp-biographies.com/t/00034146161/ is clearly the same guy as on the left. So this is John W. Davis, (April 13, 1873 — March 24, 1955), politician and lawyer. He was the Democratic Party nominee for President of the United States during the 1924 presidential election, losing to Republican candidate Calvin Coolidge. See also en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_W._Davis and bioguide.congress.gov/scripts/biodisplay.pl?index=D000121 Clayton is en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henry_De_Lamar_Clayton,_Jr. They worked together to pass the Clayton Anti-trust act.
